abstract.text: Invite your friends to draw on a shared canvas while on a FaceTime call.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Drawing content in a group session

inlineContent.text: This sample code project is associated with WWDC23 session 10241:
, and WWDC21 session 10187:

Group Activities allows you to build shared experiences across devices with SharePlay. Although its focus is on creating media experiences, you can design your own custom app experiences to share with multiple devices. The real-time interactions you unlock, and the instant reaction people who use your app get, can lead to some truly special moments.
The sample app, DrawTogether, builds on some of the concepts introduced in WWDC21 session
. It allows you to draw together while on a FaceTime call. The entire screen is the canvas, and everyone draws with a random color.
There are two steps to adopt a
: activity creation and session management. These are covered in detail in WWDC21 session
and in

These steps change slightly when building a custom experience, starting with activity creation. Activity creation consists of configuring the activity, and then activating the activity. Only the configuration part is different for a custom activity compared to a media activity.
Build the sample with Xcode 13 or later, and Swift 5.5 or later.
This sample runs on physical devices with iOS 15 or later.

To see the custom drawing experience together, install the app on two or more devices with unique Apple IDs, and start a FaceTime call between the devices. Tap the bottom-left icon, and respond to the system prompt to start a shared DrawTogether experience. On the other device, join the group session. The app gives each user a random color to draw with. When the user draws on the screen, the app propagates the drawing to all the other devices in the group session.
To make drawing a group experience, the sample defines a

inlineContent.text: After configuring the activity, the app needs to activate it at the appropriate moment. The sample provides a button for activation. First, the sample checks to make sure a
doesn’t exist already. Next, it calls the
method to make sure a FaceTime call is active and the system can create group sessions. Then, in the action closure, the sample calls its
method to activate the activity.
In its
method, the sample creates a new instance of the custom activity, and calls the
method on it. That’s all that’s necessary to activate the activity.

inlineContent.text: Late joiners are devices that join an activity session after the session starts. To ensure a proper experience, the app gives late joiners the most recent information so all the devices use the same data.
When a new device calls
on the
, every other device in the
receives an update of the
property. Devices that observe the update then send their own catch-up data (in this case, the existing drawing canvas) to the newly joined device.
The app defines its catch-up data in the
structure. This structure contains all of the existing strokes and a variable
, a heuristic that calculates which message is the most up-to-date.
The sample defines a message handler in its
method to receive this message using the

method to process the message.
The sample’s

heuristic to only accept catch-up messages that are newer than any currently saved messages. Then the sample overrides the

and the previous
. This ensures that the sample only sends catch-up messages to the newly joined participants. Finally, the sample forms and sends the message.  The message contains the current
state and sends it only to the

inlineContent.text: The Group Activities framework provides two ways to change activities: create a
, or update the activity for everyone in the existing
The sample app resets for each new drawing canvas. The sample triggers a new session when the user taps the Reset button. In this case, the sample calls its
method to reset the local state and create a
The sample’s
method removes the existing
, which allows for a clean transition to a new
in the new session.  The
method cancels any tasks for the
. It also checks for an existing
, and if one exists, it calls the
method to leave the current activity. It then calls the
method to start the activity immediately and create a session for the app. Thereafter, the sample waits for the system to deliver a
object asynchronously through the
method of the
The sample’s
view contains a button to allow users to share the canvas with their friends. The sample dynamically displays the button only when it’s helpful to the user. The sample uses the
property to determine whether a FaceTime call is active and the system can create group sessions. The
only shows the button if the system is eligible for a group session, and not in a group session already.
